title.narrative: Mechanism 9879 - Strengthening TB and HIV & AIDS Responses in Eastern Uganda (STAR-E)

description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
STAR-E's goal is to empower communities to respond effectively to the challenges posed by the HIV/AIDS and TB epidemics through increased access to, coverage of, and utilization of quality, comprehensive HIV/TB prevention, care and treatment services within district health facilities and their communities. Project coverage is in 12 districts: Budaka, Bududa, Bukwa, Busia, Butaleja, Kapchorwa, Pallisa, Mbale, Sironko, Kibuku, Bulambuli and Kween. Comprehensive HIV/TB services are provided in the region in partnership with district local governments and the Ministry of Health (MoH) to attain five results: 1) Increased uptake of comprehensive HIV/TB services within supported districts; 2) Decentralized service delivery systems strengthened for improved uptake of quality HIV/TB services; 2a) Lot Quality Assurance Sampling (LQAS) institutionalized at national level to support and coordinate district-level implementation; 3) Quality HIV/TB services delivered in all supported health facilities and communities; 4) Networks, linkages, and referral systems strengthened within and between health facilities and communities; and 5) Increased demand for comprehensive HIV/TB prevention, care, and treatment services. The prevention service package includes: Prevention of Mother-to-Child Transmission (PMTCT), HIV Testing and Counseling (HTC), condom distribution, voluntary medical male circumcision (VMMC), Positive Health, Dignity and Prevention (PHDP), Key Populations (KP) services, and sexual prevention. The care and treatment service package includes: adult/pediatric care and support, TB/HIV, nutrition through linkages, and adult/pediatric treatment. The project also provides CB TB DOTS services with the goal of attaining the national TB identification and treatment success rates. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.15: Biomedical Prevention - Medical Male Circumcision. Policy, training, outreach, message development, service delivery, quality assurance, and equipment and commodities related to male circumcision (MC). Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.6: Adult Care and Support. All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.12: Laboratory Infrastructure. Development and strengthening of laboratory systems and facilities to support HIV/AIDSrelated activities including purchase of equipment and commodities and provision of quality assurance, staff training and other technical assistance. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.11: Treatment/Adult Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.2: Sexual Prevention - Abstinence/Be Faithful. Activities (including training) to promote abstinence, fidelity, reducing multiple and concurrent partners, and related social and community norms that impact these behaviors. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.9: Counseling and Testing. Includes activities in which both HIV counseling and testing are provided for those who seek to know their HIV status (as in traditional VCT) or provider initiated counseling and testing. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.5: Sexual Prevention - Other Sexual Prevention. Other activities (including training) aimed at preventing HIV transmission including purchase and promotion of condoms, STI management (if not in palliative care settings/context), messages/programs to reduce other risks of persons engaged in high-risk behaviors. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.14: Strategic Information. HIV/AIDS behavioral and biological surveillance, facility surveys, monitoring partner results, reporting results, supporting health information systems, assisting countries to establish and/or strengthen such systems, and related analysis and data dissemination activities fall under strategic information. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.7: TB/HIV. Includes exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, treatment and prevention of tuberculosis (including medication), as well as screening and referral of TB clinic clients for HIV testing and clinical care. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.1: Preventing Mother-to-Child Transmission (PMTCT). Activities (including training) aimed at preventing mother-to-child HIV transmission, including ARV prophylaxis for HIV-infected pregnant women and newborns and counseling and support for maternal nutrition. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.13: Health System Strengthening. Include activities that contribute to national, regional or district level systems by supporting finance, leadership and governance (include broad policy reform efforts including stigma, gender, etc.), institutional capacity building, supply chain or procurement systems, Global Fund programs and donor coordination. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.17: Pediatric Care and Support. All health facility-based care for HIV-exposed children and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.18: Treatment/Pediatric Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. objectives
